core.aes package¶

core.aes.aes module¶

This is an exercise in secure symmetric-key encryption, implemented in pure Python (no external libraries needed).

Original AES-128 implementation by Bo Zhu (http://about.bozhu.me) at https://github.com/bozhu/AES-Python . PKCS#7 padding, CBC mode, PKBDF2, HMAC, byte array and string support added by me at https://github.com/boppreh/aes. Other block modes contributed by @righthandabacus.

Although this is an exercise, the encrypt and decrypt functions should provide reasonable security to encrypted messages.

class core.aes.aes.AES(master_key)¶

Bases: object

Class for AES-128 encryption with CBC mode and PKCS#7.

This is a raw implementation of AES, without key stretching or IV management. Unless you need that, please use encrypt and decrypt.

decrypt_block(ciphertext)¶

Decrypts a single block of 16 byte long ciphertext.

decrypt_cbc(ciphertext, iv)¶

Decrypts ciphertext using CBC mode and PKCS#7 padding, with the given initialization vector (iv).

decrypt_cfb(ciphertext, iv)¶

Decrypts ciphertext with the given initialization vector (iv).

decrypt_ctr(ciphertext, iv)¶

Decrypts ciphertext using CTR mode with the given nounce/IV.

decrypt_ofb(ciphertext, iv)¶

Decrypts ciphertext using OFB mode initialization vector (iv).

decrypt_pcbc(ciphertext, iv)¶

Decrypts ciphertext using PCBC mode and PKCS#7 padding, with the given initialization vector (iv).

encrypt_block(plaintext)¶

Encrypts a single block of 16 byte long plaintext.

encrypt_cbc(plaintext, iv)¶

Encrypts plaintext using CBC mode and PKCS#7 padding, with the given initialization vector (iv).

encrypt_cfb(plaintext, iv)¶

Encrypts plaintext with the given initialization vector (iv).

encrypt_ctr(plaintext, iv)¶

Encrypts plaintext using CTR mode with the given nounce/IV.

encrypt_ofb(plaintext, iv)¶

Encrypts plaintext using OFB mode initialization vector (iv).

encrypt_pcbc(plaintext, iv)¶

Encrypts plaintext using PCBC mode and PKCS#7 padding, with the given initialization vector (iv).

rounds_by_key_size = {16: 10, 24: 12, 32: 14}¶
core.aes.aes.add_round_key(s, k)¶
core.aes.aes.benchmark()¶
core.aes.aes.bytes2matrix(text)¶

Converts a 16-byte array into a 4x4 matrix.

core.aes.aes.decrypt(key, ciphertext, workload=100000)¶

Decrypts ciphertext with key using AES-128, an HMAC to verify integrity, and PBKDF2 to stretch the given key.

The exact algorithm is specified in the module docstring.

core.aes.aes.encrypt(key, plaintext, workload=100000)¶

Encrypts plaintext with key using AES-128, an HMAC to verify integrity, and PBKDF2 to stretch the given key.

The exact algorithm is specified in the module docstring.

core.aes.aes.get_key_iv(password, salt, workload=100000)¶

Stretches the password and extracts an AES key, an HMAC key and an AES initialization vector.

core.aes.aes.inc_bytes(a)¶

Returns a new byte array with the value increment by 1

core.aes.aes.inv_mix_columns(s)¶
core.aes.aes.inv_shift_rows(s)¶
core.aes.aes.inv_sub_bytes(s)¶
core.aes.aes.matrix2bytes(matrix)¶

Converts a 4x4 matrix into a 16-byte array.

core.aes.aes.mix_columns(s)¶
core.aes.aes.mix_single_column(a)¶
core.aes.aes.pad(plaintext)¶

Pads the given plaintext with PKCS#7 padding to a multiple of 16 bytes. Note that if the plaintext size is a multiple of 16, a whole block will be added.

core.aes.aes.shift_rows(s)¶
core.aes.aes.split_blocks(message, block_size=16, require_padding=True)¶
core.aes.aes.sub_bytes(s)¶
core.aes.aes.unpad(plaintext)¶

Removes a PKCS#7 padding, returning the unpadded text and ensuring the padding was correct.

core.aes.aes.xor_bytes(a, b)¶

Returns a new byte array with the elements xor’ed.

core.aes.aes.xtime(a)¶
